args: Well, I guess we'll see each other\nin the dream.
Good morning, Peony. So is this\nwhat the inside of a dream is like?
It certainly is. Oh, and look! All of your\nfriends managed to make it here.
Welcome to the world of dreams!
Oh, this is all so romantic...
Uh, it is? I thought we came here\nto kill some fiend.
Do try to expand your horizons a little,\nLuca. It would be good for you.
Thanks for playin' tour guide, Peony.\nYer the best!
My thanks. Now then, we should begin\nrestoring people's sweet dreams.
First, we'll need to release the curse\nand wake everyone up.
If we clear up their nightmare and make\nthem realize they're dreaming, I believe\nthat should do the trick.
Yes, but like Luca said, we also need\nto deal with the fiend itself.
This fiend invades dreams in order\nto devour souls, does it not?
In that case, perhaps IT will come to US.
And then we give it the ol' one-two!
The group struggles for nearly two weeks,\nbut is unable to either wake the victims\nor track down the fiend responsible.
Yeah, well, ain't none of us gettin' what\nya'd call a restful night's sleep lately.
I can't even remember what we've been\ndoing after I wake up. Everything is all\nfuzzy and... Well, like a dream, I guess.
But my body sure remembers\nhow tired it is, I tell you what...
Luca and Ranzal slackin' off again, eh?\nWant me to break out the cattle prod?\nI keep one here for just such occasions.
The opposite, in fact—I fear their constant\nwork in the dream world is leaving them\nutterly exhausted in the real one.
Oh man, tell me about it. We work like\ndogs all day, then work like bigger,\nwork-ier dogs after we go to sleep!
Dreams are a source of peace for people.\nDreams are their hope. So to think\nsomething like this is happening...
Hey, don't go blaming yourself for this!\nIt's all that dumb fiend's fault.
...I just want everyone\nto have happy dreams.
Happy dreams, huh? But you said adults\ncan't make their dreams be whatever they\nwant...
Hmm. If we combine my power with the\nwishes of children...
Ooo, I LIKE this train of thought!\nSo then if we... *whisper whisper*
Lemme tell ya, I just flew in today,\nand BOY are my wings tired!\n...That joke was way better in my head.
Hey, it's the prince's faerie! And...
Hello. I am Peony, a ljósálfar from\nLjósálfheimr, a land of wonderful dreams.
You're the one we saw in our dreams!\nI KNEW it was you!
Yeah, she swooped in and saved us\nfrom all the scary nightmares!
Yaaaay! I'm so glad you're back,\ngiant faerie lady!
Heh. And I as well. But I have come\nwith a request for all of you little ones.\nWill you hear me out?
The thing that gave you all bad dreams\nwas a naughty fiend.
Right now, the prince and his friends\nare doing their very best to find it.
But as a result, their own dreams\nhave become very sad.
I'd like to make sure they can start\nhaving happy dreams again, but I'm\ngoing to need your help.
Sure! They help us all the time,\nso we'd love to help them.
Since you are pure-hearted children,\nyou have some measure of control\nover the nature of dreams.
So I want you to wish with all your might\nthat the prince and his friends can have\nhappy dreams once more.
Okay! I'll do it! We'll ALL do it!
Adults can't control their dreams, but with\npure-hearted kids wishing for it...!

Yes. When one becomes an adult,
reality intrudes on our world, and the
thought of controlling dreams becomes
more and more an impossible one.
But if those children wish as hard as\nthey can and I use my power...
Dreams are rest and hope for people.\nMay their dreams be happy ones.
Hey, get this, {player_name}!\nI had an AWESOME dream last night!
I can't remember it super well,\nbut I know I played SO many pranks!
I had me a great dream too! I was in\na banquet hall at the ol' Hotel Ranzal,\nand there was food EVERYWHERE!
Hey, that's great! And if we all had\ngood dreams, maybe that means...
It's Peony. I know it is.\nShe's trying to help us.
